DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator that asks whether the patient has a history of thromboembolism.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Occlusion of the lumen of a vessel by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occlusion of the lumen of a vessel by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: Occlusion of the lumen of a vessel by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the identification of patients' medical records and forms.
